Authors:
Diego L. Salariato, Osvaldo Morrone, Fernando O.
Zuloaga
Title:
New monotypic genus segregated from Scutachne (Paniceae:
Panicoideae: Poaceae)
Abstract:
The genus Scutachne (Poaceae, Paniceae) is revised. This
American genus, which included two species from the Caribbean, was
circunscribed utilizing morphological and molecular characters; in order
to analyze both species of the genus, S. amphistemon and S. dura, a
detailed study of the micromorphology of the upper anthecium and leaf
anatomy, together with exomorphological characters, was performed; both
species differ in vegetative and reproductive characters, such as blade
distribution, ligules, presence of axillary inflorescences, upper glume
and lower lemma consistence, lower palea consistence, presence of a
lower flower, upper anthecium ornamentation, and presence of a rachilla
extension; regarding the anatomical pattern, S. dura is a C4 PCK
species, while S. amphistemon has C3, non-Kranz leaf anatomy. The
phylogenetic analysis, based on molecular characters, also support these
morphological differences. As a result, we concluded that Scutachne, as
presently circunscribed, is a polyphyletic genus. Therefore, the genus
Scutachne is here redefined and S. amphistemon is transfered to the new
genus. Affinities of the new genus with other genera of Paniceae are
also discussed.
